newsitem.title: TURKEY: ISTANBUL EXCHANGE TO OPEN EUROBOND MKT ON MONDAY.
newsitem.headline: ISTANBUL EXCHANGE TO OPEN EUROBOND MKT ON MONDAY.

text.p: The Istanbul Stock Exchange said it would launch an international bond market on February 24 to allow trading in Turkish Eurobonds.
"Trading in international bonds issued by the Republic of Turkey and Turkish municipalities will be allowed on the international bond market," the exchange said in a statement.
It said Turkey's 40 international issues, launched since late 1988, would be listed on the new market, including 11 Samurai, nine Euromark and 13 Eurodollar bonds.
The new market which aims to boost trade in Turkish Eurobonds and increase long-term debt availability will be open between 1000-1700 hours (0800-1500 GMT).
Trade will be in related currency with value dates ranging from three to 90 days. Deals will be settled via an account to be opened at Cedelbank by Turkey's central depository Takasbank.
